item.title: Geometry and Metric Spaces
item.description: In my senior year of college, I took a course on Euclidean and non-Euclidean Geometry.1 Euclidean Geometry was codified by the Greek mathematician Euclid, in his book Elements. It’s likely what you think of when you think about Geometry. In this blog post I’ll look at what happens if we replace a key part of this geometry we’re used to. I’ll also touch on a generalization that this exploration leads to, and some fun examples.
